intro: Willughbeia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy willughbeia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, pubescent foliage and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Willughbeia pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
